input: Dave is blue. Dave is furry. Fiona is blue. Gary is not white. Harry is furry. Harry is green. Harry is white. All green things are smart. If something is blue and furry then it is green. Blue things are kind. If Fiona is kind then Fiona is furry. All kind, furry things are blue. If something is kind then it is white. If something is smart then it is big. Question: Fiona is not big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Dave : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Blue Dave
axiom T2 : Furry Dave
axiom T3 : Blue Fiona
axiom T4 : ¬ White Gary
axiom T5 : Furry Harry
axiom T6 : Green Harry
axiom T7 : White Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Smart x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Furry x → Green x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Kind x
axiom R4 : Kind Fiona → Furry Fiona
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Furry x → Blue x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → White x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Big x

theorem fiona_is_not_big : ¬ Big Fiona :=
begin
  sorry,
end
